showScoreExcerpt: “Audience members whose knowledge of Imelda Marcos is limited to the fact that she owned 3,000 pairs of shoes will only leave with a partial understanding of this violent period. The musical has no book, and the punchy songs paint broad strokes of the 60-year history... Still, this rollicking, form-breaking musical party is well worth an RSVP.”

keyPhrases.quote: this rollicking, form-breaking musical party is well worth an RSVP
The musical has no book, and the punchy songs paint broad strokes
Audience members...will only leave with a partial understanding

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Despite significant criticisms of the book and historical depth, the critic explicitly recommends the show as 'well worth an RSVP' and praises it as a 'rollicking, form-breaking musical party.' | GPT-4o-mini: The review highlights the enjoyable aspects of the musical while acknowledging significant shortcomings in the script, leading to a positive but cautious recommendation.

dtliExcerpt: For Here Lies Love, the storied Broadway Theatre has transformed into Club Millennium, a bright, pulsating discotheque sans orchestra seats. A disc jockey (Moses Villarama) pumps up the incoming crowd as energetic ushers, clad in pink jumpsuits, play air traffic control for patrons on the dance floor. A fitting setting for a musical about the rise of a dictatorship, no?
